title: Understanding LIMIT and OFFSET
text: In SQL, the LIMIT clause is used to specify the number of records to return. The OFFSET clause is used to specify the number of records to skip before starting to return records.

title: How OFFSET Works
text: The OFFSET clause tells the database to skip a specified number of rows before starting to return rows. For example, OFFSET $$5$$ means skip the first $$5$$ rows.

title: Combining LIMIT and OFFSET
text: When you use LIMIT $$10$$ OFFSET $$5$$, it means you want to skip the first $$5$$ records and then return the next $$10$$ records.

title: Calculate the Range of Records
text: If you skip the first $$5$$ records and then take the next $$10$$, which records are you selecting?
